column4: I have a question~what is the common used argument of rsync ??
I'm reading help pages of rsync.

'rsync --dry-run --verbose --progress --stats --compress --rsh=/usr/bin/ssh --recursive --times --perms --links --delete --exclude "*bak" --exclude "*~" * user@remotehost:/target/directory' is what I always use to synchronize directories between machines.
remove the --dry-run once you trust it
one more question----How could I find if someone send message to me in irc instead of looking for it per page of irc channel?
depends on your client. Mine alerts me via the task list when it's in the background.
I'm using irssi command under freebsd.
in that case I'll be useless, sorry
Then in the case that I want to synchronize files and folders between folders and folders in the local host?
leave out the --rsh option and replace the user@remotehost part with just the target directory.
Greatly thanks for your help and advice.I'm reading manual pages of it.
